To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: I was seduced by Exceptional Customer Service

search.slidetext: "our greatest asset is the customer! treateach customer as if they are the only one!" laurice leitao customer engagement! policy / training 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

we will empower nycha through innovative technology 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only nychait nycha it mission to enable nycha to provide quality housing by delivering meaningful, innovative, high-performing, cost-effective technology solutions. nychait we will empower nycha through innovative technology
training agenda introduction and overview general conduct and protocol engagement during ongoing work escalations 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only
introduction to customer engagement c impact b objective a purpose 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only
i was seduced by exceptional customer service 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

general conduct and protocol treat all customers with respect, dignity, and professionalism. respect active listening and understanding customer needs and concerns. active listening maintain a friendly and positive attitude during interactions. positive & friendly outlook use clear and non-technical language to communicate effectively with customers. customer-centric language 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

general conduct and protocol (cont.) promptly acknowledging and responding to customer inquiries or requests. be responsive maintain customer information confidentiality. confidentiality continuous improvement and seeking customer feedback. continuous improvement 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only
your path to skill enhancement! section break poor vs great customer service 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

module 2: direct requests for it services follow the process: instruct the customer to submit the request through the appropriate channel. this will ensure that correct procedures are followed, and the best possible service is provided. how to get help: take the opportunity to educate the customer on the correct process and channels to use for future requests. for guidance on where to refer a customer for it help, see appendix c: how to get help 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only
how to get help still need help? contact business client services (bcs) it.bcs@nycha.nyc.gov 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

module 3: updates to customers regarding ongoing work meet or exceed expectations customer-centriclanguage provide regular updates transparency 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

it customer service phrases say this instead still need help? contact business client services (bcs) it.bcs@nycha.nyc.gov 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only no problem please hold or hang on i am happy to help or youre welcome, and thanks for calling that is not my department i cant please allow me to connect you to the correct person that can assist you i wish we could or ill see what i can do my computer is moving slowly im sorry you feel that way while my computer is loading, let me tell you more about ... i understand how you feel do you mind if i place you on a brief hold while i research the issue? i dont know ill be glad to look into that for you phrases to avoid

module 4: assigned work and meeting deadlines meeting invitees deadlines and due dates send out minutes coverage and absences 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only note:when discussing it issues, please ensure that only the necessary it staff are copied in the email communication. the business should be removed temporarily from the cc.

module 5: resident-impacting escalations report all resident impacting issues a inform management b report all resident impacting at nycha, our residents are important; therefore, any incident that could affect a resident must be reported to the it management team. 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only
module 6: general escalations unplanned outage meeting with senior staff delay in deliverable emails 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only
module 7: all other escalations service desk bcs 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

direct request for it services and escalations review 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only review test your knowledge: review questions groups breakout scenario nycha staff member (c) emails you regarding an application you worked on.the (c) states there have been changes in the federal guidelines, and they need additional dropdowns and fields in 90 days.the (c) has ccd their vp and evp. exercise (c) sends email, ccd their vp and evp (s) acknowledges email and loops in supervisor and pm if appropriate supervisor will notify the vp, evp and bcs if appropriate (internal it dialogue, (c) is removed from the thread) educate the (c) on how to submit a demand (s) or supervisor replies to the email, acknowledging the demand and informs (c) that the demand is being assessed exercise important note: when an it vp and/or the evp was not previously part of an email conversation and is added to the conversation by a business customer to escalate a concern or an issue, the it staff member(s) should not reply.

review question (1) 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only roles nycha staff member/business customer (c) it staff (s) groups breakout scenario nycha staff member (c) emails you regarding an application you worked on.the (c) states there have been changes in the federal guidelines, and they need additional dropdowns and fields in 90 days.the (c) has ccd their vp and evp. exercise (c) sends email, ccd their vp and evp (s) acknowledges email and loops in supervisor and pm if appropriate supervisor will notify the vp, evp and bcs if appropriate (internal it dialogue, (c) is removed from the thread) educate the (c) on how to submit a demand (s) or supervisor replies to the email, acknowledging the demand and informs (c) that the demand is being assessed question when should it staff reply to an email conversation that has been escalated to include an it vp/evp by a business customer? always reply, do not keep the customer waiting. only reply if you have relevant information to share. do not reply; the it vp/evp will handle the communication from this point. all of the above ?

review question (1) answer 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only roles nycha staff member/business customer (c) it staff (s) groups breakout scenario nycha staff member (c) emails you regarding an application you worked on.the (c) states there have been changes in the federal guidelines, and they need additional dropdowns and fields in 90 days.the (c) has ccd their vp and evp. exercise (c) sends email, ccd their vp and evp (s) acknowledges email and loops in supervisor and pm if appropriate supervisor will notify the vp, evp and bcs if appropriate (internal it dialogue, (c) is removed from the thread) educate the (c) on how to submit a demand (s) or supervisor replies to the email, acknowledging the demand and informs (c) that the demand is being assessed question when should it staff reply to an email conversation that has been escalated to include an it vp/evp by a business customer? always reply, do not keep the customer waiting. only reply if you have relevant information to share. do not reply; the it vp/evp will handle the communication from this point. all of the above ?

review question (2) 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only roles nycha staff member/business customer (c) it staff (s) groups breakout scenario nycha staff member (c) emails you regarding an application you worked on.the (c) states there have been changes in the federal guidelines, and they need additional dropdowns and fields in 90 days.the (c) has ccd their vp and evp. exercise (c) sends email, ccd their vp and evp (s) acknowledges email and loops in supervisor and pm if appropriate supervisor will notify the vp, evp and bcs if appropriate (internal it dialogue, (c) is removed from the thread) educate the (c) on how to submit a demand (s) or supervisor replies to the email, acknowledging the demand and informs (c) that the demand is being assessed question ? when should it staff escalate an issue or concern? an unplanned outage is impacting multiple business users or critical business service is down. an agreed-upon timeline/deliverable will not be met on a critical issue. an incident impacts an evp or above. any incident that could affect a resident. all of the above.

review question (2) answer 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only roles nycha staff member/business customer (c) it staff (s) groups breakout scenario nycha staff member (c) emails you regarding an application you worked on.the (c) states there have been changes in the federal guidelines, and they need additional dropdowns and fields in 90 days.the (c) has ccd their vp and evp. exercise (c) sends email, ccd their vp and evp (s) acknowledges email and loops in supervisor and pm if appropriate supervisor will notify the vp, evp and bcs if appropriate (internal it dialogue, (c) is removed from the thread) educate the (c) on how to submit a demand (s) or supervisor replies to the email, acknowledging the demand and informs (c) that the demand is being assessed question ? when should it staff escalate an issue or concern? an unplanned outage is impacting multiple business users or critical business service is down. an agreed-upon timeline/deliverable will not be met on a critical issue. an incident impacts an evp or above. any incident that could affect a resident. all of the above.

"to give real service, you must add something which cannot be bought or measured with money, and that is sincerity and integrity. don alden adams conclusion it.bcs@nycha.nyc.gov 2023 nycha, all rights reserved internal use only

a purpose the purpose of the customer engagement policy is to establish a framework and best practices for customer engagement between us, nycha, it and our customers and colleagues. this policy is designed to foster exceptional customer service and it gives us a framework to follow when interacting and communicating with our business customers. insight to purpose

objective b insight to objective the objectives of the policy are to ensure: it has a documented framework and an established set of standards to manage business interactions with our customers in a consistent manner. to guide the engagement process with other business departments within nycha along with residents, partners and all other customers of nycha it services to strengthen our communication and improve the overall customer experience.

impact c insight to impact the impact of the policy is improved customer satisfaction. if implemented effectively, this policy will bring many benefits such as better communication, increased satisfaction, enhanced services, better collaboration with our customers, and fewer escalations. this will help improve its image and reputation.
